my account is deactivated

County coordinators can change password, deactivate and activate accounts for the workforce members under them.
 On Dashboard -> Workforce members > Details (Activate, Deactivate, Change Password Buttons at bottom)

Please reset

responses:
County coordinators can change password, deactivate and activate accounts for the workforce members under them.
 On Dashboard -> Workforce members > Details (Activate, Deactivate, Change Password Buttons at bottom)
Use the forgot password functionality to reset your password.
Use the forgot password functionality with your email  to reset your account.

The CPIMS reset password reset link is located on the login page just after the submit button or you can click on
 this link: https://childprotection.go.ke/accounts/password/reset/

kindly take note that you can be able to reset your passwords using the functionality highlighted above and follow the instructions given thereafter. however for those who have not used the system for over three months or those who can remember the email used when creating the account can contact their supervisors or the admni.

patterns: Who created you?
When was you created?
Who was your creator?
WHo devloped you?
who were your developers
when were you created?
responses: I was created by 2 students from Kabarak University during a hackathon in February 2023 as an alternative to an inferior bot. I am a product of their innovation and dedication to providing the best possible service to users.

I was created by Kabarak University developers during a hackathon in February 2023. My purpose is to serve as an alternative to another chatbot, and to provide users with enhanced features and functionality.
I was created by developers at Kabarak University during a February 2023 hackathon. The aim was to provide a solution for child protection managers to improve their work in safeguarding children.

patterns: when I discharge some children from institution some disappear from pending cases
What type of discharge when the subject is committed to prison or remand
The system doesn't recognize teachers
responses:
For a case to 'disappear from pending' as you put it, you must have provided at least one service by managing encounters.
 If you don't manage any encounter but you manage a service, referral or court session, it still remains pending. So, there is a great chance that in some cases you have not managed an encounter hence them remaining as pending.
It should be added as one of the options. It exists and children are always committed for short sharp sentences.

patterns: How do you admit child who had already escaped?

responses: Fill a new case record sheet for him/her
Re-occuring cases allow admission but new CRS has to be created and old admission must be discharged.

patterns: What is the list of child offenders

Indecent Assault (excludes defilement), Traffic Offence (Touting), Contempt of Court, Begging,
 Prostitution, Insulting, Lying/perjury, Breach of the Peace/Creating disturbance, Murder, Assault 
Intention to commit a felony, aiding a prisoner to escape, harboring.

patterns: Where can I report crime alerts real time for realtime response from security agencies.
Which code should I use to log in the platform
How should i report a crime
Will my identity be anonymous to the security
How much will the message cost
responses: You will report on a digital platform called mulika uhalifu and use a short code 22068.
The short code is 22068 and you can save this code under mulika uhalifu.

When you witness crime, quickly take your phone, go to messages, write the name of your region, then message, then your exact location, then send to the short code. Within seconds, you will receive a message informing you that your message will be relayed to authorities. All security agencies will receive your message and the ones nearest you respond to it within minutes.

patterns: I cant log in into the live system using the default password 1234
Having problems with login in the live system for the first time
Hello can I get assistance in the opening of the live system
responses:
First you start by login to the system.
 You put your username and password as 1234.Click log in. The system will prompt you to enter old password put old password as1234 and finally create a new password using a combination of at least 8 characters, capital letter, small letters and special characters ($,@,?,&)

It's either you are not created in the live system or
 the username you are using is wrong or you at one point before login and forgot your password therefore unable to access the system...
